attributes.action: Cancel upcoming A levels and give students UCAS predicted grades. Delay GCSEs.
attributes.additional_details: The sitting of these exams now puts students and their families at risk. A levels can't be delayed so UCAS predicted grades must be used.
attributes.background: UCAS predicted grades should be fixed as students' official grades for this year. Those  not on UCAS could use previous evidence (such as mocks) to determine A level grades, or could opt to sit next year if they have no university offers pending. GCSEs should be delayed until pandemic contained.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
